body:
This lesson provides an overview of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the key differences from the existing data protection regulations.

After completion, you should able to work more confidently with the requirements of the GDPR.
displayTitle: Introduction to the General Data Protection Regulation
title: Introduction to the General Data Protection Regulation

_skills.outcome: Describe what the GDPR is and why it is needed
Identify the scope of the GDPR
Identify the legal basis for processing of personal data and its implications
Explain the fundamental rights of individuals outlined in the GDPR
Create a plan for ensuring compliance with the GDPR

_aboutPage.aboutCredit: This guidance is based upon information from the Regulation EU 2016/679 (General Data Projection Regulation) and the Information Commissioner's Office (UK).

body: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) comes into effect on 25 May 2018 and will have a significant impact on the way we manage, hold and process data at Lloyd’s. This lesson looks at how GDPR affects your role at Lloyds and what to do to ensure compliance.
displayTitle: How does the General Data Protection affect my role at Lloyd’s of London?
title: How does the General Data Protection affect my role at Lloyd’s of London?

body:
GDPR is first and foremost about guaranteeing strong data protection principles for consumers.

However, it shouldn’t just be seen as a matter of compliance. Adherence to GDPR also offers many opportunities such as stimulating innovation and strengthening customer relationships. 

This lesson explores some of the opportunities and looks at how GDPR can be turned from a compliance exercise into an opportunity.
title: The opportunities of GDPR

_skills.outcome: Describe how other sectors are embracing the opportunities offered by GDPR
List the 5 key opportunities offered by GDPR for the insurance market
Understand how to position GDPR as an opportunity (rather than a compliance issue) in your organisation
